20110119060412.000|20110119060414.000|CC1|YOU?

20110119060434.000|20110119060435.000|CC1|THEN SHE CAN PUT IT BACK ON MY  
20110119060435.000|20110119060437.000|CC1|FINGER.

20110119060439.000|20110119060441.000|CC1|THAT MEANS SHE RECOGNIZES ME IS 
20110119060441.000|20110119060443.000|CC1|BECAUSE SHE'S DONE THAT BEFORE. 
20110119060443.000|20110119060444.000|CC1|I MEAN, BEFORE THIS ACCIDENT.   
20110119060444.000|20110119060446.000|CC1|SHE DOES THAT ALL THE TIME.

20110119060553.000|20110119060554.000|CC1|>> SHE REACHED UP, AND, FOR TEN 
20110119060554.000|20110119060556.000|CC1|MINUTES, RUBBING MY NECK.

20110119060557.000|20110119060600.000|CC1|ICU.

20110119060604.000|20110119060605.000|CC1|BUT IT'S SO TYPICAL OF HER THAT 
20110119060605.000|20110119060607.000|CC1|NO MATTER HOW BAD THE SITUATION 
20110119060607.000|20110119060609.000|CC1|MIGHT BE FOR HER, SHE'S LOOKING 
20110119060609.000|20110119060612.000|CC1|OUT FOR OTHER PEOPLE.           
20110119060612.000|20110119060612.000|XDS|%   LENGTH: 0:05:00 of 0:59:00
20110119060612.000|20110119060612.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THE BULLET FIRED   
20110119060612.000|20110119060616.000|CC1|INTO HER HEAD ENTERED HER       
20110119060616.000|20110119060617.000|CC1|FOREHEAD AND EXITED IN THE BACK.
20110119060617.000|20110119060620.000|CC1|WE UNDERSTAND THAT IT WAS A     
20110119060620.000|20110119060621.000|CC1|BULLET THAT WENT THROUGH THE    
20110119060621.000|20110119060623.000|CC1|UPPER PART OF THE LEFT LOBE.    
20110119060623.000|20110119060624.000|CC1|DID THEY TELL YOU ABOUT WHAT    
20110119060624.000|20110119060625.000|CC1|FUNCTIONS COULD BE --           
20110119060625.000|20110119060627.000|CC1|>> YES, THEY DO.                
20110119060627.000|20110119060628.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WHAT DO THEY SAY?  
20110119060628.000|20110119060630.000|CC1|>> WELL, TO SOME EXTENT IT CAN  
20110119060630.000|20110119060632.000|CC1|VARY FROM PERSON TO PERSON, AND 
20110119060632.000|20110119060633.000|CC1|EVEN WHICH FUNCTION IS ON WHICH 
20110119060633.000|20110119060634.000|CC1|SIDE OF THE BRAIN CAN VARY FROM 
20110119060634.000|20110119060638.000|CC1|PERSON TO PERSON.               
20110119060638.000|20110119060640.000|CC1|AND SHE'S RIGHT-HANDED, AND     
20110119060640.000|20110119060642.000|CC1|THIS, YOU KNOW, THIS INJURY IS  
20110119060642.000|20110119060643.000|CC1|ON THE LEFT SIDE OF HER BRAIN,  
20110119060643.000|20110119060646.000|CC1|AND THEY CAN GIVE YOU A GENERAL 
20110119060646.000|20110119060646.000|CC1|IDEA OF WHAT IS IN THOSE AREAS, 
20110119060646.000|20110119060647.000|CC1|SO --                           
20110119060647.000|20110119060648.000|CC1|>> Reporter: MORE ABOUT THAT    
20110119060648.000|20110119060650.000|CC1|LATER.                          
20110119060650.000|20110119060651.000|CC1|BUT HOW IS IT POSSIBLE THAT JUST
20110119060651.000|20110119060653.000|CC1|FOUR DAYS AFTER THE SHOOTING,   
20110119060653.000|20110119060655.000|CC1|WHEN HER BEST FRIENDS FROM      
20110119060655.000|20110119060657.000|CC1|CONGRESS, HER SISTERHOOD,       
20110119060657.000|20110119060659.000|CC1|ENTERED THE HOSPITAL ROOM, SHE  
20110119060659.000|20110119060700.000|CC1|OPENED HER EYES WHEN SHE HEARD A
20110119060700.000|20110119060703.000|CC1|FAMILIAR AND PENETRATING VOICE? 
20110119060703.000|20110119060705.000|CC1|>> DEBBIE, WHO IS A VERY GOOD   
20110119060705.000|20110119060706.000|CC1|FRIEND OF OURS, HAS A VERY      
20110119060706.000|20110119060708.000|CC1|DISTINCTIVE LONG ISLAND ACCENT. 
20110119060708.000|20110119060712.000|CC1|>> SHE STARTED TO OPEN HER EYES 
20110119060712.000|20110119060713.000|CC1|JUST A SLIT, AND NOBODY COULD   
20110119060713.000|20110119060717.000|CC1|BELIEVE IT.                     
20110119060717.000|20110119060717.000|XDS|%   LENGTH: 0:06:00 of 0:59:00
20110119060717.000|20110119060719.000|CC1|>> IT WAS JUST A -- A REALLY

20110119060749.000|20110119060750.000|CC1|>> Reporter: NOT ONLY ABOUT     
20110119060750.000|20110119060751.000|CC1|CONGRESSWOMAN GIFFORDS, BUT     
20110119060751.000|20110119060753.000|CC1|THOSE WHO DIED.
